body:
Comment 14: 
I tried this on my dreamplug and it works.
Well, it gets way past the archive/tar test.
The math test passes too, and then runtime
fails with memory allocation issues.
(The dreamplug is tiny and weird so not
terribly surprised.)

When archive/tar fails, it will leave behind
a 5.out file in that directory.  Could you please
attach that in a reply to this issue?
I want to see exactly which instruction
is causing the trap.

Thanks.
Russ
